title: Chinny Aranols New Book Jutrida is the Gripping Tale of a Woman Who Longs to Open Up About Her Deranged Marriage After her Husband Dies, but Lacks the Courage
text:
Recent release “Jutrida” from Page Publishing author Chinny Aranol is a shocking tale of the terrifying events Jutrida endures before, and after her husband's death.
(PRWEB) October 23, 2015
Chinny Aranol, an American nurse born in Nigeria, has completed her new book “Jutrida”: a distressing story of a woman given to a unbalanced man, forced into a polygamous pagan family, and stripped of any hope for escape.
Published by New York City-based Page Publishing, Chinny Aranol’s powerful story centers around Jutrida, a woman plagued by tremendous sorrow and pain.
Jutrida was born in Nigeria to Christian, relatively affluent parents but married very young into a polygamous pagan family. She had not thought of marriage when her parents gave her away to a post war veteran almost twice her age. Her husband's very queer behaviors, including gross infidelity and lack of interest or involvement in his family affairs, caused Jutrida a great deal of anguish throughout the marriage.
All the very bizarre incidents that occurred during the course of their relationship and events during the burial and funeral ceremonies caused Jutrida torment and misery, even after her husband’s death. She never told anyone of her pain or the happenings, because her husband made her promise never to tell what transpired, but now she longed to open up.
She found the inspiration to at least put the issues down in writing after listening to Oprah Winfrey's Super Soul Programs, particularly her interview with Tyler Perry. Putting the problems down in writing gave her some relief and compiling it into a readable manuscript has brought almost a complete cure as someone out there might have answers to her troubling questions.
Readers who wish to experience this engrossing work can purchase “Jutrida” at bookstores everywhere, or online at the Apple iTunes store, Amazon, Google Play or Barnes and Noble.
